strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="4">1.0% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, ensuring that donor funds are utilized for direct service delivery rather than administrative overhead.
The charity reports a <cite id="5">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 spent per $1 raised</cite>, maximizing the impact of every contribution.
The foundation has seen a rapid expansion in its financial capacity, achieving a <cite id="9">3-year revenue CAGR of 373.0%</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Najam Institute's financial structure is optimized for direct impact, as evidenced by its <cite id="4">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>. This lean operation is supported by its ability to generate <cite id="3">over $1.1 million in annual revenue</cite> without incurring traditional fundraising costs. Beyond its own educational programs like the <cite id="2">Najam Seminary</cite>, the organization extends its reach through significant grantmaking, including <cite id="10">$300,000 provided to MATW International Ltd</cite> for humanitarian purposes. This dual approach allows the institute to maintain <cite id="7">local community centers</cite> while supporting large-scale relief efforts.
rich_narrative.summary: Najam Institute Foundation Inc is a Georgia-based organization that integrates <cite id="1">humanitarian relief with accessible classical Islamic education</cite>. The organization operates several distinct programs, including the <cite id="2">Najam Seminary, Najam Academy, and Najam Relief</cite>, designed to provide families with both spiritual knowledge and material support. Financially, the organization experienced significant growth recently, reporting <cite id="3">total revenue of $1,181,926</cite> in the 2023 tax year. A defining characteristic of its financial model is its <cite id="4">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, indicating that all reported spending is directed toward its core mission and services. Furthermore, the institute demonstrates <cite id="5">high fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending $0.00 per $1 raised. While the organization maintains a <cite id="6">direct provision delivery model</cite>, its primary geographic focus remains within the United States, specifically serving communities through centers in <cite id="7">Decatur and Lilburn</cite>. In addition to direct services, the foundation acts as a facilitator for broader humanitarian efforts, distributing <cite id="8">$433,411 in total grants</cite> to other nonprofit entities during the most recent reporting period.
